task_summary: The robot must detect, approach, and avoid any obstacles while moving toward the scissors, as seen in the contact sheet.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop robot arm identifies the position of a pair of scissors among other objects, then moves toward it while avoiding obstruction by carefully navigating and aligning above the scissors. The robot's sequence leverages perception, approach, obstacle avoidance, and retreat motions. The central role is to prove robust navigation and approach capability in a cluttered tabletop scene with the scissors as the explicit goal.
preconditions: Scissors are present within manipulation workspace.
No objects are grasped; workspace lighting is nominal.
stepwise_plan: Confirm scissors are visible, or scan until visible.
Move the end effector above the scissors, avoiding obstacles (i.e., other objects on the table).
Approach and align precisely over the scissors.
Make a lateral move to avoid final contact (obstacle avoidance step).
success_criteria: Robot moves above the scissors without collision.
Obstacle (if present, as in the visual frames) is avoided.
Robot completes approach and retreat without error.
failure_and_recovery: Failure: Scissors not visible—retry scan (up to 3 attempts).
Failure: No approach path—abort motion, report.
Failure: Obstacle blocks path—abort or adjust lateral move.
task_long_description.termination: Behavior ends after retreat confirms successful approach and no collisions occurred.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: avoid obstacle and reach the scissors

node_specs.description: Checks if the scissors are currently visible in the workspace.
Performs a scanning pattern (line) to find the scissors, retrying up to 3 times.
Attempts to localize the scissors after they are visible.
Moves the end effector directly above the scissors with a 10 cm upward offset.
Carefully approaches and aligns over the scissors, with minimal lateral deviation (tight tolerance).
Moves 5 cm along the y-axis to avoid final obstacle and enable safe approach.
Withdraws the arm 10 cm from last position, confirming safe retreat after approach.

recovery_strategy: Retry scanning up to three times to find the scissors
Abort move if path is blocked or adjust lateral move
Retreat if contact or collision is detected
assumptions: Frames show a clear tabletop environment with a robot arm approaching scissors. No grasp is performed (just approach and retreat), which reflects the instruction and evidence.
If an obstacle is encountered, MoveDelta provides lateral avoidance; path is not dynamically replanned.
Instruction implies obstacle avoidance but does not request grasping; this matches observed frame sequences.

expected_success_criteria: Robot reliably detects and approaches the scissors
No collisions with other objects (obstacles) occur
Scissors are reached and lateral avoidance (if any) succeeds
